notes.title: About Me
notes.content: I'm Martin Heßmann, a Product Generalist who bridges the gap between design, development, and business needs.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: I'm neither exclusively a PM, Developer, nor Designer—but a blend of all three, helping teams create intuitive, accessible, and impactful digital experiences.

sections.title: Experience
sections.content:
With over a decade in the tech industry, I've developed a holistic approach to product development:

• Translating business requirements into technical specifications
• Bridging communication gaps between diverse stakeholders
• Creating design systems that scale with product growth
• Implementing front-end solutions with modern frameworks
• Building processes for sustainable team collaboration

sections.title: Philosophy
sections.content: My philosophy: Great products emerge from the intersection of design intuition, technical possibility, and business necessity.

sections.title: Superpower
sections.content: My superpower is combining design thinking with technical understanding and business acumen to create exceptional digital products. I excel at translating user needs and business objectives into actionable strategies while ensuring technical feasibility and design excellence.

notes.title: Work Philosophy
notes.content: My approach to product development and team collaboration.

sections.title: 1. Users First, Always
sections.content: I believe in deeply understanding user needs before writing a single line of code or drawing a single pixel.

sections.title: 2. Simplicity Over Feature Bloat
sections.content: Every feature must earn its place in the product. When in doubt, simplify.

sections.title: 3. Collaborative Creation
sections.content: The best products emerge from cross-functional teams working closely together, respecting each other's expertise.

sections.title: 4. Data-Informed, Not Data-Driven
sections.content: Data provides insights, but doesn't replace human judgment or empathy.

sections.title: 5. Continuous Improvement
sections.content: Products are never 'done' - they evolve through constant learning and iteration.

notes.title: Project Guidelines
notes.content: Key principles for successful project execution.

sections.title: Planning
sections.content:
• Start with clear objectives and success metrics
• Break down large tasks into manageable chunks
• Set realistic timelines with buffer for unknowns

sections.title: Execution
sections.content:
• Daily stand-ups to track progress
• Regular stakeholder updates
• Document decisions and rationale

sections.title: Review
sections.content:
• Weekly progress reviews
• Monthly retrospectives
• Quarterly strategy alignment
